definition: right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: He exchanged dark looks with his wife, Petunia .
sentences.chinese: 他和妻子意味深长地对望一眼。

sentences.english: Both of them looking at his face all smile.
sentences.chinese: 两人对望一眼，脸上都露出了笑容。

sentences.english: Then they looked at each other for a moment without speaking.
sentences.chinese: 后来他们默默无言，彼此对望了一会。

sentences.english: At the time, there are many variables, parting, easy goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 对望时，世上有多少变数，离别时，易再见了。

sentences.english: We looked at each other nervously.
The couple turned to each other, and the husband nodded24)solemnly to his wife.
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩对望了一下，然后丈夫严肃地朝妻子点了点头。

definition: to look at each other in dismay (idiom)
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to agree by chance (idiom); taking the same action without prior consultation
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to have heard what was said

combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书[liu4 shu1] of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds/to comprehend without being told explicitly/to cotton on/knowing (smile, glance etc)
to turn one's head/to turn around
